lines.text: The nicest thing about feeling happy is that you think you'll never be unhappy again.
[first lines]
She's... well, she's something a little strange. That's what she noticed, that she's not a woman like all the others. She seems all wrapped up in herself. Lost in a world she carries deep inside her.
[last lines]
I love you so much. That's the one thing I never said to you, because I was afraid of losing you forever.
That can never happen now. This dream is short, but this dream is happy.
No matter how lonely she may be she keeps men at a distance.
She's probably got bad breath or something.
You only know the reality that was stuck up your ass!
Why should I think about reality in this stink hole? That's like "Why should I get more depressed that I already am?".
You're worse than I thought! Do you use these movies to jerk yourself off?

[Crying]
If you don't stop, I will never speak to you again!
Stop crying! You sound just like an old woman!

[Whimpering]
It's what I am! It's what I am!

[Forcing Molina's legs apart]
What's this between your legs, huh? Tell me, "lady"!
It's an accident. If I had the courage, I'd cut it off.
You'd still be a man! A MAN! A MAN IN PRISON! JUST LIKE THE FAGGOTS THE NAZIS SHOVED IN THE OVENS!
This girl's finished.
What girl?
Me, stupid!
Molina, you would never understand.
What I understand is me offering you a bit of my lovely avocado and you throw it back in my face.
Don't talk like that! You're just like a...
A what? Go on, say it.
[Arregui pauses]

[to Molina]
Shaddap! You damn faggot!

[to Molina]
You faggot piece of shit! You fell in love with that bastard?
Stop crying! You sound just like an old woman!
It's what I am! It's what I am!

[Violently separating Molina's legs]
What's this between your legs, eh? Tell me, "lady"!
It's an accident. If I had the courage I'd cut it off.
You'd still be a man. A MAN! A man in prison! Just like the faggots the Nazis shoved in the ovens!
